alert.note: Alert for Conway; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Johnson County Higher Elevations; Marion; Newton County Higher Elevations; Newton County Lower Elevations; Northwest Searcy County Higher Elevations; Northwest Yell County; Pope County Higher Elevations; Searcy County Lower Elevations; Southeast Van Buren County; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Van Buren County Higher Elevations; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Logan, Searcy, southeastern Newton, eastern Johnson, south central Marion, northwestern Van Buren, western Conway, northeastern Yell and Pope Counties through 1030 PM CST... At 945 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Jasper to near Danville. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Russellville... Danville... Marshall... Dardanelle... Atkins... Pottsville... Dover... London... Knoxville... Hector... Witts Spring... Duff... Maumee... Bohannon... Mosley... Watts... Holman... Carden Bottoms... Dillen... Broomfield... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
